page.title: 13BRIERLEY HILL GLASS CO. 01
page.content: Mr Breese had l4 children. One of the children was Terry's father. Terry's father worked at Stourbridge Glass until World War 2 broke out and the glass works closed because no one could afford to buy glass. He was given a job as a person mending planes in Wolverhampton. During the war he started to cut glass in his back garden. He used a motorbike engine to turn the wheel round. Then he had a decision to make; whether to go to work for a big business or to set up his own business. The factory he decided to buy was quite small and cheap. It was in Talbots Lane. Mr Breese is 77 now, he has Terry, 3 brothers, 2 sisters, 1 daughter_in_law all working in the company now. It started about thirty years ago as a family concern and is still a local, family business.
